page.title: 03The Landscape.(West).
page.content: Looking down from Shutter Point in the S.W.you see Great Shutter Rock which, according to folklore,would nicely stopper the nearby Devil's Limekiln. This is a natural funnel-shaped feature which is 76 metres wide at the top and which plunges ,almost vertically,for 91 metres to sea level. Further east is Seal's Hole-a large sea cave where seals are supposed to breed. On the Windward coast,north of Shutter Point,are the Montagu Steps;these were built during the attempted salvage of the first-class battleship Montagu after she foundered here in May 1906. A little further north again is Pilot's Quay.This is no longer used due to a landslip in 1911.During most of the 1800's pilots were required in the Bristol Channel and were picked up here during E.winds.
